2const PENDING = 'pending'

9const promiseState = Symbol("promiseState")

12class Yo {
13  constructor(executor) {
14    // executor æå‰æ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œå¦‚æœæœ‰å¼‚å¸¸åˆ™ä¸åˆ›å»ºé¢å¤–çš„å†…éƒ¨å˜é‡å’Œå±æ€§æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œç›´æ¥æŠ›å‡ºå¼‚å¸¸
15    if(executor === $undefined) {

17    }
18    if(typeof executor !== $function) {
19      throw new TypeError("Executor must be a function.")
20    }
21    this[promiseState] = PENDING // 2.1.1
22    this[promiseValue] = $undefined

30  $resolve(value) {

32    this[promiseState] = FULFILLED // 2.1.1.1
33    this[promiseValue] = value // 2.1.2.2

38    this[promiseState] = REJECTED // 2.1.1.1
39    this[promiseValue] = reason // 2.1.3.2
40  }
41}

class Yo {
2  constructor(executor) {
3    ...
4    this[promiseConsumers] = []
5    try {
6      executor(this.$_resolve.bind(this), this.$reject.bind(this))
7    } catch (e) {
8      this.$reject.bind(this)(e)
9    }
10  }
11 
12  $resolve(value) {
13    if(this[promiseState] !== PENDING) return // 2.1.2.1, 2.1.3.1
14    this[promiseState] = FULFILLED // 2.1.1.1
15    this[promiseValue] = value // 2.1.2.2
16    this.broadcast()
17  }
18 
19  $reject(reason) {
20    if(this[promiseState] !== PENDING) return // 2.1.2.1, 2.1.3.1
21    this[promiseState] = REJECTED // 2.1.1.1
22    this[promiseValue] = reason // 2.1.3.2
23    this.broadcast()
24  }
25 
26  static then(onFulfilled, onRejected) {
27    const promise = new Yo(nop) // then æ–¹æ³•è¿”å›çš„æ–°å®ä¾‹
28    // 2.2.1.1
29    promise.onFulfilled = typeof onFulfilled === $function ? onFulfilled : $undefined;
30    // 2.2.1.2
31    promise.onRejected = typeof onRejected === $function ? onRejected : $undefined;
32    // 2.2.6.1, 2.2.6.2
33    this[promiseConsumers].push(promise)
34    this.broadcast()
35    // 2.2.7
36    return promise
37  }
38 
39  static broadcast() {
40    const promise = this;
41    // 2.2.2.1, .2.2.2.2, 2.2.3.1, 2.2.3.2
42    if(this[promiseState] === PENDING) return
43    // 2.2.6.1, 2.2.6.2, 2.2.2.3, 2.2.3.3
44    const callbackName = promise[promiseState] === FULFILLED ? "onFulfilled" : "onRejected"
45    const resolver = promise[promiseState] === FULFILLED ? "$resolve" : "$reject"
46    soon(
47      function() {
48        // 2.2.6.1, 2.2.6.2, 2.2.2.3, 2.2.3.3
49        const consumers = promise[promiseConsumers].splice(0)
50        for (let index = 0; index < consumers.length; index++) {
51          const consumer = consumers[index];
52          try {
53            const callback = consumer[callbackName] // è·å– then æ–¹æ³•æ‰§è¡Œçš„æ—¶å€™ä¼ å…¥çš„å‡½æ•°
54            const value = promise[promiseValue]
55            // 2.2.1.1, 2.2.1.2, 2.2.5 without context
56            if(callback) {
57              consumer['$resolve'](callback(value))
58            } else {
59              // onFulfilled / onRejected ä¸æ˜¯å‡½æ•°
60              // 2.2.7.3, 2.2.7.4
61              consumer[resolver](value)
62            }
63          } catch (e) {
64            // å¼‚å¸¸åˆ™è®¾ä¸º rejected
65            consumer['$reject'](e)
66          }
67        }
68      }
69    )
70  }
71}
72 
73// soon function come from Zousan.js
74const soon = (() => {
75  const fq = [],  // function queue
76    // avoid using shift() by maintaining a start pointer
77    // and remove items in chunks of 1024 (bufferSize)
78    bufferSize = 1024
79  let fqStart = 0
80  function callQueue() {
81    while(fq.length - fqStart) {
82      try {
83        fq[fqStart]()
84      } catch (err) {
85        console.log(err)
86      }
87      fq[fqStart++] = undefined // increase start pointer and dereference function just called
88      if(fqStart === bufferSize) {
89        fq.splice(0, bufferSize)
90        fqStart = 0
91      }
92    }
93  }
94  // run the callQueue function asyncrhonously as fast as possible
95  // æ‰§è¡Œæ­¤å‡½æ•°ï¼Œè¿”å›çš„å‡½æ•°èµ‹å€¼ç»™ cqYield
96  const cqYield = (() => {
97    // è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°å¹¶ä¸”æ‰§è¡Œ
98    // This is the fastest way browsers have to yield processing
99    if(typeof MutationObserver !== 'undefined')
100    {
101      // first, create a div not attached to DOM to "observe"
102      const dd = document.createElement("div")
103      const mo = new MutationObserver(callQueue)
104      mo.observe(dd, { attributes: true })
105 
106      return function() { dd.setAttribute("a",0) } // trigger callback to
107    }
108 
109    // if No MutationObserver - this is the next best thing for Node
110    if(typeof process !== 'undefined' && typeof process.nextTick === "function")
111      return function() { process.nextTick(callQueue) }
112 
113    // if No MutationObserver - this is the next best thing for MSIE
114    if(typeof setImmediate !== _undefinedString)
115      return function() { setImmediate(callQueue) }
116 
117    // final fallback - shouldn't be used for much except very old browsers
118    return function() { setTimeout(callQueue,0) }
119  })()
120  // this is the function that will be assigned to soon
121  // it take the function to call and examines all arguments
122  return fn => {
123    fq.push(fn) // push the function and any remaining arguments along with context
124    if((fq.length - fqStart) === 1) { // upon addubg our first entry, keck off the callback
125      cqYield()
126    }
127  }
128})()

ç”±äºéœ€è¦å¤„ç†å¤æ‚çš„resolveå‡½æ•°ï¼Œè€Œä¸ä»…ä»…åœ¨å…¶settledä¹‹åæ›´æ”¹çŠ¶æ€å’Œè®¾ç½®valueæˆ–è€…reasonï¼Œæˆ‘é€‰æ‹©å°†æ­¤æ–¹æ³•å‘½åä¸º$_resolveï¼Œä»è€Œä¸åŸæ¥ç®€å•çš„$resolveæ–¹æ³•åŒºåˆ†å¼€æ¥ã€‚

class Yo {
2  ...
3    $_resolve(x) {
4    let hasCalled,then;
5    // 2.3.1
6    if(this === x) {
7      console.log('circular');
8      throw new TypeError("Circular reference error, value is promise itself.")
9    }
10    // 2.3.2
11    if(x instanceof Yo) {
12      console.log('instance');
13      // 2.3.2.1, 2.3.2.2, 2.3.2.3
14      x.then(this.$_resolve.bind(this), this.$reject.bind(this))
15    } else if(x === Object(x)) {
16      // 2.3.3
17      try {
18        // 2.3.3.1
19        then = x.then;
20        if(typeof then === $function) {
21          // 2.3.3.3
22          then.call(
23            x,
24            // first argument resolvePromise
25            function(y) {
26              if(hasCalled) return
27              hasCalled = true
28              // 2.3.3.3.1
29              this.$_resolve(y)
30            }.bind(this),
31            // second argument is rejectPromise
32            function (reasonY) {
33              if(hasCalled) return
34              hasCalled = true
35              // 2.3.3.3.2
36              this.$reject(reasonY)
37            }.bind(this)
38          )
39        } else {
40          // 2.3.3.4 åŸå§‹å€¼
41          this.$resolve(x)
42        }
43      } catch (e) {
44        // 2.3.3.2, 2.3.3.3.4 å¼‚å¸¸
45        if(hasCalled) return // 2.3.3.3.4.1
46        this.$reject(e) // 2.3.3.3.4.2
47      }
48    } else {
49      // 2.3.4 åŸå§‹å€¼
50      this.$resolve(x)
51    }
52  }
53  ...
54}
